cards.definition: The enthalpy change when 1 mole of gaseous ions dissolve in water such that the solution is infinitely dilute.
The enthalpy change when all atoms are separated in a chemical substance.
The heat that is released/absorbed when solute dissolves in solvent at a constant pressure.
The enthalpy change when one mole of a compound in its standard state is formed from its constituent elements in their standard states under standard conditions.
The enthalpy change when one mole of a compound is burned completely in oxygen under standard conditions, and with everything in their standard states.
The enthalpy change when solutions of an acid and an alkali (base) react together under standard coditions to produce 1 mole of water.
The enthalpy change whern a specific amount of substance changes from a liquid to gas at a constant temperature and pressure.
The heat that a solid absorbs when it changes state from a solid to a liquid.
Measure of the strength of forces between ions in an ionic solid.
The enthalpy change when 1 mole of covalent bonds, in a gaseous molecule, are broken under standard conditions.
The amount of energy (in Joules) it takes to raise the temperature of a substance by 1K.
